dexed":true,"name":"channelId","type":"uint256"},{"components":[{"name":"channelId","type":"uint256"},{"name":"channelType","type":"address"},{"name":"participants","type":"address[]"},{"name":"turnNum","type":"uint256"},{"name":"gameAttributes","type":"bytes"}],"indexed":false,"name":"nextState","type":"tuple"},{"indexed":false,"name":"signature","type":"bytes"}],"name":"ForceMoveResponded","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"alternativeRespondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"details":"Allows the response of an active forceMove Challenge by canceling with a different state signed by the     challenge's issuer. Then proceeds to create a challenge for the alternativeState.","params":{"alternativeState":"The state replacing the challenge's state. Must have the same turnNum as it,                         and thus, be signed by the same person.","channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","nextState":"The next state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from the alternativeState.","signatures":"The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to alternativeState and nextState in that order"}},"challengeAfter(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"details":"Allows a user to challenge a funded channel's exit, by providing a direct spend, in order to prevent the     use of unauthorized tokens.","params":{"blockNumber":"BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof","channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","index":"Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged","proof":"Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block","signature":"Signature of the txBytes proving the validity of it.","txBytes":"RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge After. See CheckAfter for conditions."}},"challengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"details":"Allows a user to create a Plasma Challenge targeting a funded channel's exit in order to prevent the use of      unauthorized tokens. A plasma challenge is any previous transaction of the token that must be proved invalid      by a direct spend of it.","params":{"blockNumber":"BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof","channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","index":"Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged","proof":"Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block","txBytes":"RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge Before. See CheckBefore for conditions."}},"challengeBetween(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"details":"Allows a user to challenge a funded channel's exit, by providing a previous double spend, in order to prevent the     use of unauthorized tokens.","params":{"blockNumber":"BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof","channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","index":"Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged","proof":"Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block","signature":"Signature of the txBytes proving the validity of it.","txBytes":"RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge Between. See CheckBetween for conditions."}},"closeChallengedChannel(uint256)":{"details":"Allows a user to close and unanswered channel after a Challenge Before was made","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel"}},"closeUnfundedChannel(uint256)":{"details":"Allows a creator of a channel to close if it is unfunded and retrieve the stakes.","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel"}},"conclude(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"details":"Allows conclusion of a channel whether if there is an expired challenge or by providing the last states","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","lastState":"Last State, which must be a valid transition from prevState and also validate as a final state.                  Ignored if an expired challenge is present","prevState":"State previous to last state. Ignored if an expired challenge is present.","signatures":"The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to prevState and lastState in that order.                  Ignored if an expired challenge is present"}},"forceFirstMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes))":{"details":"Allows the creation of a forceMove Challenge for the first move in a channel.","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","initialState":"The initial state of the channel. Must comply with the initialArgumentsHash of the channel.                    Will be the starting point to validate the forceMove response"}},"forceMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"details":"Allows the creation of a forceMove Challenge for the any move in a channel.","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","fromState":"The previous to current state of the channel","signatures":"The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to fromState and toState in that order","toState":"The current state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from fromState"}},"fundChannel(uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Allows a player respond to a channel creation, funding it.     the winner of it to be able to reclaim it, using within it any plasma tokens deposited on rootChain.","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","exitData":"The encoded exitData to be decoded by the channelType of the plasma tokens being used by                    the opponent.","initialGameAttributes":"The encoded initial state to be decoded by the channelType"}},"initiateChannel(address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Allows a player to create a Force Move Channel against an opponent, staking an amount of ether declaring     the winner of it to be able to reclaim it, using within it any plasma tokens deposited on rootChain.","params":{"channelType":"The address of the contract implementing PlasmaTurnGame interface to determine the type of game","exitData":"The encoded exitData to be decoded by the channelType of the creator's plasma tokens being used by                    the creator.","initialGameAttributes":"The encoded initial state to be decoded by the channelType","opponent":"The address of the user who will be facing the creator","stake":"The amount of money to be staking. Same amount of ether must accompany the function call."}},"respondChallengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes32,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Allows a user to respond to a Plasma Challenge targeting a funded channel's exit. For validity go to CheckResponse","params":{"challengingTxHash":"Hash of the transaction being challenged with.","channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","index":"Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged","proof":"Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of respondingTransaction in the Plasma block","respondingBlockNumber":"BlockNumber of the respondingTransaction to be checked for the inclusion proof.","respondingTransaction":"Transaction signed by the challengingTxHash owner showing a spent","signature":"Signature of the respondingTransaction to prove its validity"}},"respondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes)":{"details":"Allows the response of an active forceMove Challenge.","params":{"channelId":"Unique identifier of the channel","nextState":"The next state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from the challenge's state.","signature":"The signature corresponding to nextState"}},"withdraw()":{"details":"Allows an address to extract the funds locked in this contract"}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"alternativeRespondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"notice":"Changes the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there is any.Emits ForceMoveResponded eventEmits ForceMoveRequested event"},"challengeAfter(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"notice":"Emits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGED"},"challengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"notice":"Pushes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChallengeRequest eventSets channel's state to SUSPENDEDA bond must be locked to prevent unlawful challenges. If the challenge is not answered, the bond is returned."},"challengeBetween(uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes,uint256)":{"notice":"Emits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGED"},"closeChallengedChannel(uint256)":{"notice":"Removes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGEDThe bond is returned to the challengers, with the stakes of the channel to the first valid one."},"closeUnfundedChannel(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets channel's state to CLOSEDEmits ChannelConcluded event"},"conclude(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"notice":"Sets channel's state to CLOSED. Stakes are added to the winner.Emits ChannelConcluded event"},"forceFirstMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes))":{"notice":"Modifies the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there isn't any"},"forceMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes[])":{"notice":"Modifies the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there isn't any.Emits ForceMoveRequested eventEither the fromState or toState must be signed one by each of the channel's participants to be a valid        transition, so it is ok to assume both parties agreed on these states."},"fundChannel(uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Appends ExitData to exits, sets the fundedTimestamp for the channelSets channel's state to FUNDEDEmits ChannelFunded event"},"getFunds(address)":{"notice":"//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// /            Getters ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////"},"initiateChannel(address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Appends a FMChannel to channels, ExitData to exits.Emits ChannelInitiated event"},"respondChallengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes32,uint256,bytes,bytes,bytes)":{"notice":"Removes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChallengeResponded eventSets channel's state to FUNDED if no more challenges are leftThe bond is given to the responder."},"respondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address,address[],uint256,bytes),bytes)":{"notice":"Removes alternativeRespondWithMove(uint256,(uint.details: Allows the response of an active forceMove Challenge by canceling with a different state signed by the     challenge's issuer. Then proceeds to create a challenge for the alternativeState.

params.alternativeState: The state replacing the challenge's state. Must have the same turnNum as it,                         and thus, be signed by the same person.
params.nextState: The next state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from the alternativeState.
params.signatures: The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to alternativeState and nextState in that order

challengeAfter(uint256,uint256,bytes,byt.details: Allows a user to challenge a funded channel's exit, by providing a direct spend, in order to prevent the     use of unauthorized tokens.

params.blockNumber: BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof
params.index: Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged
params.proof: Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block
params.signature: Signature of the txBytes proving the validity of it.
params.txBytes: RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge After. See CheckAfter for conditions.

challengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes,by.details: Allows a user to create a Plasma Challenge targeting a funded channel's exit in order to prevent the use of      unauthorized tokens. A plasma challenge is any previous transaction of the token that must be proved invalid      by a direct spend of it.

params.blockNumber: BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof
params.index: Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged
params.proof: Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block
params.txBytes: RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge Before. See CheckBefore for conditions.

challengeBetween(uint256,uint256,bytes,b.details: Allows a user to challenge a funded channel's exit, by providing a previous double spend, in order to prevent the     use of unauthorized tokens.

params.blockNumber: BlockNumber of the transaction to be checked for the inclusion proof
params.index: Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged
params.proof: Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of txBytes in the Plasma block
params.signature: Signature of the txBytes proving the validity of it.
params.txBytes: RLP encoded bytes of the transaction to make a Challenge Between. See CheckBetween for conditions.

closeChallengedChannel(uint256).details: Allows a user to close and unanswered channel after a Challenge Before was made

closeUnfundedChannel(uint256).details: Allows a creator of a channel to close if it is unfunded and retrieve the stakes.

conclude(uint256,(uint256,address,addres.details: Allows conclusion of a channel whether if there is an expired challenge or by providing the last states

params.lastState: Last State, which must be a valid transition from prevState and also validate as a final state.                  Ignored if an expired challenge is present
params.prevState: State previous to last state. Ignored if an expired challenge is present.
params.signatures: The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to prevState and lastState in that order.                  Ignored if an expired challenge is present

forceFirstMove(uint256,(uint256,address,.details: Allows the creation of a forceMove Challenge for the first move in a channel.

params.initialState: The initial state of the channel. Must comply with the initialArgumentsHash of the channel.                    Will be the starting point to validate the forceMove response

forceMove(uint256,(uint256,address,addre.details: Allows the creation of a forceMove Challenge for the any move in a channel.

params.fromState: The previous to current state of the channel
params.signatures: The signatures (array of size 2) corresponding to fromState and toState in that order
params.toState: The current state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from fromState

fundChannel(uint256,bytes,bytes).details: Allows a player respond to a channel creation, funding it.     the winner of it to be able to reclaim it, using within it any plasma tokens deposited on rootChain.

params.exitData: The encoded exitData to be decoded by the channelType of the plasma tokens being used by                    the opponent.
params.initialGameAttributes: The encoded initial state to be decoded by the channelType

initiateChannel(address,address,uint256,.details: Allows a player to create a Force Move Channel against an opponent, staking an amount of ether declaring     the winner of it to be able to reclaim it, using within it any plasma tokens deposited on rootChain.

params.channelType: The address of the contract implementing PlasmaTurnGame interface to determine the type of game
params.exitData: The encoded exitData to be decoded by the channelType of the creator's plasma tokens being used by                    the creator.
params.initialGameAttributes: The encoded initial state to be decoded by the channelType
params.opponent: The address of the user who will be facing the creator
params.stake: The amount of money to be staking. Same amount of ether must accompany the function call.

respondChallengeBefore(uint256,uint256,b.details: Allows a user to respond to a Plasma Challenge targeting a funded channel's exit. For validity go to CheckResponse

params.challengingTxHash: Hash of the transaction being challenged with.
params.index: Index corresponding to the exit's index to be challenged
params.proof: Bytes needed for the proof of inclusion of respondingTransaction in the Plasma block
params.respondingBlockNumber: BlockNumber of the respondingTransaction to be checked for the inclusion proof.
params.respondingTransaction: Transaction signed by the challengingTxHash owner showing a spent
params.signature: Signature of the respondingTransaction to prove its validity

respondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address.details: Allows the response of an active forceMove Challenge.

params.nextState: The next state of the channel. Must be a valid transition from the challenge's state.

withdraw().details: Allows an address to extract the funds locked in this contract

alternativeRespondWithMove(uint256,(uint.notice: Changes the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there is any.Emits ForceMoveResponded eventEmits ForceMoveRequested event

challengeAfter(uint256,uint256,bytes,byt.notice: Emits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGED

challengeBefore(uint256,uint256,bytes,by.notice: Pushes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChallengeRequest eventSets channel's state to SUSPENDEDA bond must be locked to prevent unlawful challenges. If the challenge is not answered, the bond is returned.

challengeBetween(uint256,uint256,bytes,b.notice: Emits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGED

closeChallengedChannel(uint256).notice: Removes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChannelChallenged eventSets channel's state to CHALLENGEDThe bond is returned to the challengers, with the stakes of the channel to the first valid one.

closeUnfundedChannel(uint256).notice: Sets channel's state to CLOSEDEmits ChannelConcluded event

conclude(uint256,(uint256,address,addres.notice: Sets channel's state to CLOSED. Stakes are added to the winner.Emits ChannelConcluded event

forceFirstMove(uint256,(uint256,address,.notice: Modifies the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there isn't any

forceMove(uint256,(uint256,address,addre.notice: Modifies the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there isn't any.Emits ForceMoveRequested eventEither the fromState or toState must be signed one by each of the channel's participants to be a valid        transition, so it is ok to assume both parties agreed on these states.

fundChannel(uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: Appends ExitData to exits, sets the fundedTimestamp for the channelSets channel's state to FUNDEDEmits ChannelFunded event

initiateChannel(address,address,uint256,.notice: Appends a FMChannel to channels, ExitData to exits.Emits ChannelInitiated event

respondChallengeBefore(uint256,uint256,b.notice: Removes a ChallengeLib.Challenge to challengesEmits ChallengeResponded eventSets channel's state to FUNDED if no more challenges are leftThe bond is given to the responder.

respondWithMove(uint256,(uint256,address.notice: Removes the channel's forceMoveChallenge if there is any.Emits ForceMoveResponded event
